title: Self-Regulation and Social Skills Enhancement in Digital Classroom Environments: Short-Intensive Course Based on 1:1 Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and secondary-level science education experience
context.additional_context: Customized science education course for adult learners in a BYOD environment, emphasizing self-regulated learning competencies while requiring instructional design for social skill development using digital tools.

learning_goals: Learners can execute at least three self-regulated learning strategies (e.g., time management, goal setting) using digital tools in the science learning process
Learners can improve perspective-taking ability by 20% through collaborative problem-solving activities with peers in a mobile microlearning environment
Learners can produce science project outcomes that promote social interaction (feedback provision, empathetic communication) in a digital classroom environment
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
